events.title: Discovery of King Tutankhamun's Tomb Announced
events.description: Howard Carter announced the discovery of the tomb of Pharaoh Tutankhamun in the Valley of the Kings, one of the most significant archaeological finds in Egyptology.
events.significance: Provided invaluable insight into ancient Egyptian culture and history, sparking worldwide interest in Egyptology.

events.title: Fidel Castro Becomes Prime Minister of Cuba
events.description: Fidel Castro formally assumed the position of Prime Minister of Cuba, consolidating power after the Cuban Revolution.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of Castro's long-term leadership and the establishment of a communist government in Cuba.

events.title: Lithuania Declares Independence from Russia
events.description: Lithuania officially declared its independence, establishing itself as a sovereign state after centuries of foreign rule.
events.significance: Signaled the re-establishment of Lithuania as an independent nation-state following World War I.

events.title: Napoleon Bonaparte Declares Himself Emperor of the French
events.description: Napoleon crowned himself Emperor in a ceremony symbolizing the peak of his power during the French Empire.
events.significance: Marked the transition of France from republic to empire, significantly impacting European politics and wars.

events.title: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs Premieres
events.description: Walt Disney's 'Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs,' the first full-length animated feature film, premiered in Hollywood.
events.significance: Revolutionized animation and cinema, establishing feature-length animated films as a viable genre.
